etymology.description: 先 (earlier; first) + 辈/輩 (generation; cohort) = earlier generation → forebears.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of being earlier with the notion of a generation to denote people from earlier generations. Often conveys respect for predecessors in a family or field.
etymology.simplification: 輩 was simplified to 辈 by reducing the 車 component and streamlining the structure around 非 to cut strokes; 先 remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们缅怀先辈，学习他们的精神(我們緬懷先輩，學習他們的精神)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen miǎnhuái xiānbèi, xuéxí tāmen de jīngshén.
examples.english: We commemorate our forebears and learn from their spirit.

examples.chinese: 她向科学界的先辈致敬(她向科學界的先輩致敬)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàng kēxuéjiè de xiānbèi zhìjìng.
examples.english: She pays tribute to the forebears of the scientific community.

examples.chinese: 作为后生，我们要尊敬先辈(作為後生，我們要尊敬先輩)。
examples.pinyin: Zuòwéi hòushēng, wǒmen yào zūnjìng xiānbèi.
examples.english: As the younger generation, we should respect our predecessors.
